member.name: M:FluentSpotifyApi.Builder.Search.ISearchTypeBuilder`1.Matching(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{FluentSpotifyApi.Builder.Search.QueryFields,System.Boolean}})
member.param: The predicate expression. The == operator is used for exact match while method is used for partial match. The <= and >= operators can be used to specify range. Multiple statements can be combined using && or || operators. Since search query does not support precedence of operators, the operands and operators are just emitted from left to right. There is also a limited support for negation. The != operator or ! method call can be used to negate match. To negate range, the range expression must be prefixed with ! operator (e.g. !(f.Year >= 2000 && f.Year <= 2015)). The method can be used to get query in string format.

member.name: M:FluentSpotifyApi.Builder.Search.ISearchTypeBuilder`1.Matching(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{FluentSpotifyApi.Builder.Search.QueryFields,System.Boolean}},FluentSpotifyApi.Expressions.Query.QueryOptions)
member.param: The predicate expression. The == operator is used for exact match while method is used for partial match. The <= and >= operators can be used to specify range. Multiple statements can be combined using && or || operators. Since search query does not support precedence of operators, the operands and operators are just emitted from left to right. There is also a limited support for negation. The != operator or ! method call can be used to negate match. To negate range, the range expression must be prefixed with ! operator (e.g. !(f.Year >= 2000 && f.Year <= 2015)). The method can be used to get query in string format.

member.name: M:FluentSpotifyApi.Builder.User.Playlists.Tracks.IPlaylistTracksBuilder.GetAsync(System.Action{FluentSpotifyApi.Expressions.Fields.IFieldsBuilder{FluentSpotifyApi.Model.Page{FluentSpotifyApi.Model.PlaylistTrack}}},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get full details of the tracks of a playlist owned by a Spotify user.
member.param: The action for building fields. The method can be used to get fields in string format.
The maximum number of tracks to return. Default: 100. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 100.
The index of the first track to return. Default: 0 (the first object).

member.name: M:FluentSpotifyApi.Builder.User.Playlists.Tracks.IPlaylistTracksBuilder.ReorderAsync(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Reorder a track or a group of tracks in a playlist.
member.param: The position of the first track to be reordered.
The position where the tracks should be inserted.
The amount of tracks to be reordered. Defaults to 1 if not set.
The playlist's snapshot ID against which you want to make the changes.

member.name: M:FluentSpotifyApi.Expressions.Fields.IFieldsBuilder`1.Exclude``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}})

member.name: P:FluentSpotifyApi.Expressions.Query.QueryOptions.RemoveSpecialCharacters
member.summary: If set to true, removes ["] characters from exact match and [":] characters from partial match. Set to false by default.

member.name: P:FluentSpotifyApi.Expressions.Query.QueryOptions.NormalizePartialMatch
member.summary: If set to true, converts OR and NOT words to lowercase and distributes field name and NOT operator in partial match. (e.g. f => f.Artist.Contains("NOT") && !f.Artist.Contains("nice so*") will be converted into "artist:not NOT artist:nice NOT artist:so*") Set to false by default.
